channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: The Saturday night clash is an all-Victorian affair on the Gold Coast as Richmond tackle North Melbourne at Metricon Stadium.
item.title: AFL 2020 live updates: Rampaging Richmond Tigers dominating North Melbourne Kangaroos, Josh Caddy and Jack Ziebell injured, Dylan Grimes on report

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: The accused's lawyer has claimed his client suffered post traumatic stress after escaping the war in Afghanistan.
item.title: Man to defend murder charge over Pyrmont stabbing on mental health grounds

item.dc:creator: Jim Pavlidis
item.description: No sooner had the AFL announced that there would be no more football in Victoria for at least 10 weeks, thoughts immediately turned to possible locations for 2020’s Big Dance.
item.title: It's been a big week in art ... with Jim Pavlidis

item.description: Tiger Woods is the reigning Masters champion and, as he is still in the world's top 15, is fancied in some quarters to win a 16th major at the US PGA Championship in three weeks.
item.title: Woods feels his age as back problems add to frustration

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The game looked over with the Knights leading 20-0 before the Rabbitohs came to life, although it was too little, too late in the end.
item.title: Knights hang on to deny epic comeback as Souths spring to life at the death

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Tigers have lit the fuse before their clash with the Eels this week, with a joint-venture source claiming Ryan Matterson left the club after a parting shot.
item.title: 'You'll never win a grand final – I want out': Matterson's parting shot at Tigers

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic continues to spread around Australia and the world.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 217 new cases and another three deaths; Australian death toll rises to 119

item.description: The fire at the historic 15th-century building comes 15 months after a massive blaze tore through Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.
item.title: Arson suspected in fire at historic French cathedral in Nantes

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: On the day Sydney welcomed fans back to the SCG, the Swans dared to win but lost by more.
item.title: Swans excite but Suns continue red-and-white misery

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The A-League's resumption has not brought Central Coast improved fortunes, as Alen Stajcic's side suffered a record 11th successive defeat.
item.title: Glory snap winless streak as Mariners equal record number of defeats

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: David Sandurski prepared six grand final fields at the MCG and believes the Gabba can do the occasion justice should the grand final be held in Queensland.
item.title: Pitch perfect: Gabba boss says he can deliver for grand final

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: The girl and boy are fighting for life after they were discovered unresponsive in the pool at a home in Casula.
item.title: Two toddlers critical after being pulled from backyard pool in Sydney

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The AFL have issued a public apology to Indigenous players and their families for not providing them with sufficient clarity about whether pneumococcal vaccinations were required.
item.title: AFL's regret for 'distress' caused by vaccination confusion

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: Premier announces a crackdown on patrons standing around and socialising
item.title: No singing, no dancing, no mingling

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Geelong will give Gary Ablett all the time he needs before trying to return to football after the dual Brownlow medallist left the club's West Australian hub.
item.title: Ablett leaves West Australian hub but wants to play again in 2020

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Hawthorn has a good record against premiership contenders since midway through last year but after two poor performances the heat is on.
item.title: Bounce back or list questions will become louder

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Two-thirds of Australians have been exposed to a potentially mind-altering cat parasite, a new study has found.
item.title: Cat mind-altering virus widespread in Australia: study

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Authorities are concerned about the spread of coronavirus into nursing homes in regional Victoria, as a fall in overall case numbers eased the prospect of the state being forced into stage four lockdown.
item.title: Outbreaks in regional Victoria as prospect of stage four lockdown eases

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of Cartoons, July 19, 2020

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race guide and tips for Narrandera on Sunday

item.description: Tim Donnelly has three runners at Narrandera today, and he saddles up two of the more interesting horses across the meeting.
item.title: Miss Amelia leads Donnelly's three-pronged assault at Narrandera

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: The first resident of Wamberal to lose his home to the sea in 1978 says he has been waiting more than 40 years for the ocean to claim further victims.
item.title: 'Those homes should never have been built': The 40-year saga behind Wamberal beach erosion

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Just days after overturning the decision to sack two Canterbury players, the NRL appeals committee will make a call on the future of Isaac Moses.
item.title: Appeals committee to determine fate of NRL's biggest manager

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The NBL has already pushed its season back to a December start but commissioner Jeremy Loeliger admits the league is looking at other options in case they have to delay it even further.
item.title: Virus spike could push season back, says NBL boss

item.description: It comes after academics said the figures included people who had tested positive, recovered and died of other causes.
item.title: British government orders review of virus death figures

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Brisbane's club legends are hurting, with some convinced a sense of entitlement and lack of respect for the jersey is behind the crisis at Red Hill.
item.title: 'I turned it off': Brisbane greats angered by Broncos demise

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: St Kilda have spent the season searching for the right mix with their forward-ruck combinations and have this week opted to leave out defender-turned-forward Jonathon Marsh.
item.title: Saints pick Ryder in pursuit of right ruck mix

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Sydney University took out last year's Shute Shield final and got the chocolates once again on Saturday in a grand-final rematch against the Rats.
item.title: New-look Students hold off Warringah in spicy grand final rematch

item.description: A week in photos from the award winning Sydney Morning Herald and Australian Financial Review photographers
item.title: Photos of the week, July 16, 2020

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Godolphin two-year-old Alcyone underlined his VRC Derby credentials at Flemington on Saturday, saluting as an odds-on favourite over 1800 metres.
item.title: Treble for Johnny Allen as Alcyone makes Derby claim

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Chris Waller has been patient with Giovanna Run and has her marked as a Flight Stakes filly after winning on the Kensington track at Randwick on Saturday.
item.title: Giovanna Run could be another Waller winter gem

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The mural captures the essence of the respected activist, fighting for the rights of Indigenous Australians with a microphone in hand.
item.title: Brisbane Indigenous leader honoured with mural in West End

item.description: “Schools need clear, consistent, effective national guidelines, not mixed messages and political ultimatums."
item.title: Biden: Science, not politics, should decide school reopening

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: AOC president John Coates is back on the IOC executive as the body tries to find a way to host the Tokyo Games amid a worsening global pandemic.
item.title: Coates' final term with IOC set to be his greatest challenge

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Canterbury blew a 12-point lead to lose 28-22, ruining interim head coach Steve Georgallis' first game in charge.
item.title: Toe blow for Foran adds to Bulldogs’ woes after fightback from Dragons

item.description: COVID-19 is affecting peoples with lesser resistance even to already common diseases and limited access to healthcare, potentially wiping out some smaller groups.
item.title: Remote region of Brazil's Amazon counts first deaths by virus

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The state-owned corporation was ordered to cease logging in the forest near Coffs Harbour for 40 days after the Environment Protection Authority found the trees.
item.title: NSW Forestry Corporation accused of felling giant trees in state forest

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Both sides had their moments in a see-sawing contest on Saturday - but Brisbane were better for longer in their 20-point win.
item.title: Rampant Lions make short work of sleeping Giants

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: In this surreal season, Levi Casboult has confounded 10 years of living contract-to-contract to become one of Carlton's most valued players.
item.title: Dropping the Moneyball: How clubs missed the boat on Casboult

item.description: Alan Moir, The Sydney Morning Herald's political cartoonist, sketches the political unreality.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Alan Moir

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: The Sikh philosophy of selfless service has seen volunteers mobilise in Melbourne to deliver free meals to needy groups impacted by the global pandemic.
item.title: Meet the Sikhs who keep coming to the rescue for vulnerable Victorians

item.description: Carlton's dark days are too raw and numerous for anybody at the Blues to get carried away by the recent rays of light, says assistant coach John Barker.
item.title: False dawn or return of a powerhouse? Blues face another litmus test

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Australian cricket is in mourning after the death of former Test captain and wicketkeeper Barry Jarman, who has died in Adelaide aged 84.
item.title: Former Australian Test captain Barry Jarman dies, age 84

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bunbury
item.description: In a rare interview, Russell Crowe explains why he's good at self isolation, how he distrusts the media and why directing movies is the greatest job in the world.
item.title: Russell Crowe on iso life, the media and new film Unhinged

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From a podcast with singer Jack River to a streamed film from Nick Cave and a film festival, we have your week in Sydney covered.
item.title: Best of the week: What to see, hear and do July 19-25

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: The comedian is the latest entertainer to tell us what they are doing at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: Comedian Urzila Carlson on what keeps her busy

item.dc:creator: Candice Chung
item.description: A chicken and mushroom congee is just one dish that's gently expanding the typical brunch palate.
item.title: Pina Pop-Up By Room 10 a testing ground for new favourites

item.dc:creator: Paul Byrnes
item.description: Religion and horror go together like a ghost and a sheet – and the sheet in The Vigil covers a dead body in the front room of an orthodox Hasidic Jewish house.
item.title: The Vigil digs into Jewish mythology and delivers spine-tingling shocks
